articles.description: Sam Nunberg, formerly an aide on Donald Trump’s presidential campaign, launched an hours-long, barely comprehensible tear through the media involving numerous back-to-back TV interviews as well as phone calls to local media on Monday. Nunberg is very upset th…
articles.title: Sam Nunberg: This Entire Meltdown Is Because I Didn't Want to Manually Search My Email Inbox
articles.author: Tom McKay

articles.description: The Oscars, a former Trump aide and tariffs were on the minds of late-night comedy hosts as they began the week.
articles.title: Best of Late Night: Stephen Colbert Is Delighted by Sam Nunberg’s Media Tour
articles.author: SOPAN DEB

articles.description: Rosa, second from right, an unauthorized immigrant living with her family in New York, used to receive about $190 a month from the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program. Fearing deportation, she has stopped taking the benefits.
articles.title: Spooked by Trump Proposals, Immigrants Abandon Public Nutrition Services
articles.author: EMILY BAUMGAERTNER

articles.description: David Shulkin, the Veterans Affairs secretary, has been locked in a bitter and unusually public battle with a band of Trump administration officials who he said were out to overthrow him.
articles.title: In Battle Over Future of Veterans’ Care, Moderation Wins, for Now
articles.author: NICHOLAS FANDOS and DAVE PHILIPPS

articles.description: Speaker Paul D. Ryan in Washington on Wednesday. On a variety of contentious issues, Mr. Ryan, who rose to prominence as an outspoken leader, has receded in the face of a fractured caucus and a mercurial president.
articles.title: Once Outspoken, Paul Ryan Wields His Speaker’s Gavel Gingerly
articles.author: SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

articles.description: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
articles.title: Asia and Australia Edition: North Korea, Sergei Skripal, Rohingya: Your Wednesday Briefing
articles.author: INYOUNG KANG and CHARLES McDERMID

articles.description: Maybe President Trump shouldn't criticize anyone over ratings. Donald Trump has a storied history of hating the Oscars, so it's not exactly surprising he'd fire off a tweet when it was announced that the Academy Awards continued its newfound tradition of dwin…
articles.title: Jimmy Kimmel shoves Trump's trash talkin' Tweet back in his face
articles.author: Brian Koerber

articles.description: In November 2017, President Donald Trump called the hunting of elephants for their trophy tusks a "horror show." It appeared that Trump, who lacks stable policy positions on many issues, strongly opposed the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service's (FWS) decision to …
articles.title: Trump administration nixes ban on hunted elephant tusks being carried into the U.S.
articles.author: Mark Kaufman

articles.description: Confession: I've never seen a single episode of The Bachelor. I've come to this life decision for a few reasons: I'm generally bad at keeping up with TV, which is time consuming. I prefer to spend the minutes I have doing things like catching horses in The Le…
articles.title: Why watching 'The Bachelor' via Twitter is better than the real thing
articles.author: MJ Franklin

articles.description: President Trump pushed back against reports that his White House is in chaos after the resignations of senior staff members.
articles.title: No Chaos in White House, Trump Says, ‘Only Great Energy’
articles.author: EILEEN SULLIVAN

articles.description: Republicans intensified pressure on Mr. Trump to relent on his steel and aluminum tariffs while the president indicated he might provide exemptions for certain countries.
articles.title: Trump Reaffirms Commitment to Tariffs but Opens Door to Compromise
articles.author: ANA SWANSON, MARK LANDLER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: President Trump leading a round-table discussion on trade with corporate leaders at the White House last week. He has announced plans for stiff tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.
articles.title: Trump Hates the Trade Deficit. Most Economists Don’t.
articles.author: JIM TANKERSLEY

articles.description: Sam Nunberg, an adviser in the early weeks of the Trump campaign, has been subpoenaed in the investigation by Robert Mueller, the special counsel. On Monday, Mr. Nunberg conducted an unusual media tour, describing his plans to flout the subpoena.
articles.title: Tariffs, Sam Nunberg, Net Neutrality: Your Tuesday Briefing
articles.author: CHRIS STANFORD

articles.title: Europe Edition: Italy’s Election, American Tariffs, Sergei Skripal: Your Tuesday Briefing

articles.description: During a joint press conference with Swedish Prime Minister Stefan Löfven, President Trump said a trade war would hurt other countries more than it would hurt the US.
articles.title: Trump: Trade war won't hurt us

articles.description: In an interview with CNN's Erin Burnett, former Trump campaign aide Sam Nunberg attacks the White House following a day of bizarre interviews about special counsel Robert Mueller's Russia investigation.
articles.title: Nunberg attacks Trump camp: They're pathetic

articles.description: President Donald Trump jokes about Melania leaving him. CNN's Jeanne Moos wonders if the first lady is laughing.
articles.title: Trump jokes about Melania leaving him

articles.description: President Trump said he believes North Korea's overtures to end its nuke program are sincere. But others aren't so sure. CNN's Will Ripley and Barbara Starr report.
articles.title: Does N. Korea have secret strategy behind new pledges?

articles.description: President Trump's threatened tariffs on aluminum and steel may invite retaliation on the coal industry.
articles.title: Trump's tariffs could ricochet on coal country
articles.author: Matt Egan

articles.description: What are people doing with all that Bitcoin money? Blowing it on cartoon cats, apparently. Here's what else you need to know to Get Up to Speed and Out the Door. (You can also get "5 Things You Need to Know Today" delivered to your inbox daily. Sign up here.)
articles.title: 5 things you need to know today
articles.author: Doug Criss, CNN
